Posts.Content: Jun 2, 2009 07:52PM mjones777 wrote: Thank you Doreen.  I am wondering what lighter sleeves you use.  Maybe I could get a different one.  You are right about the heat though.  I don't wear my sleeve at social functions, people stare so much, strange as it may seems, but especially at church.  I find people looking at my arm instead of in my eyes when we shake hands. thank you again for your advice.

Posts.Content: mjones777 wrote: I had a radical mastectomy in 1980.  I have been cancer free with no radiation, etc.  I have had 5 or so lymphadema attacks with my right arm.  I have a lymphapress pump and my arm is doing pretty good.  My question is do I need to keep wearing my compression sleeve if I pump my arm on a regular basis.  I live in AZ and it's really hot in the summer.  I want to do what's best to keep my arm healthy.  Any advice for me.  I am 76 years of age.  Thank you Log in to post a reply
